qas.question: What group funds the Augmented Foundation Programme?
Where is the Augmented Programme required for further education?
In what educational institution is the program found?
Where is the Extension Centre for the USP?
Which students go into the Augmented Foundation Programme?

context: Fetuvalu offers the Cambridge syllabus. Motufoua offers the Fiji Junior Certificate (FJC) at year 10, Tuvaluan Certificate at Year 11 and the Pacific Senior Secondary Certificate (PSSC) at Year 12, set by the Fiji-based exam board SPBEA. <a4_0>Sixth form<a4_0/> students who pass their PSSC go on to the Augmented Foundation Programme, funded by the <a0_0>government of Tuvalu<a0_0/>. This program is required for tertiary education programmes <a1_0>outside of Tuvalu<a1_0/> and is available at the <a2_0>University of the South Pacific<a2_0/> (USP) Extension Centre in <a3_0>Funafuti<a3_0/>.
